Ingredients: beef strips,    bell peppers,    garlic,    onion,    fajita seasoning,    tortillas,    lime juice,    cilantro,    olive oil,    salt and pepper,    chili powder,    cumin,    paprika,    dried oregano,    flour tortillas,    sour cream,    guacamole,    salsa,    cheese,    cilantro,    tomatoes
Instructions: In a bowl, combine the minced garlic, olive oil, lime juice, chili powder, ground cumin, paprika, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Mix well to create a marinade. Place the sliced flank steak in a resealable plastic bag or a shallow dish. Pour the marinade over the steak, ensuring it is well coated. Marinate the steak in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes, or ideally, for a few hours to enhance the flavor. Heat a large skillet or grill pan over medium-high heat. Add the marinated steak to the hot skillet, reserving the marinade. Cook the steak for about 3-4 minutes per side until it is cooked to your desired level of doneness. Remove the steak from the skillet and set it aside. In the same skillet, add the sliced bell pepper and onion. Cook for about 5 minutes until they become tender and slightly charred. Return the cooked steak to the skillet with the bell pepper and onion. Pour in the reserved marinade. Stir everything together and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. Remove the skillet from heat. Warm the flour tortillas in a separate dry skillet or in the microwave according to the package instructions. Serve the Beef Fajitas by placing a portion of the steak, bell pepper, and onion mixture onto a warm tortilla. Add your desired toppings such as sour cream, guacamole, salsa, shredded cheese, chopped cilantro, or diced tomatoes. Fold the tortilla over the filling to form a fajita. Repeat the process with the remaining tortillas and filling.

Ingredients: chicken thighs or breasts,    honey,    soy sauce,    garlic,    ginger,    vinegar,    olive oil,    salt and pepper,    Dijon mustard,    dried thyme,    parsley,    roasted potatoes
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). In a small bowl, whisk together the honey, soy sauce, Dijon mustard, minced garlic, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to create the glaze. Season the chicken breasts with salt and pepper on both sides. Heat the olive oil in an oven-safe skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat. Add the seasoned chicken breasts to the skillet and sear them for about 2-3 minutes on each side until they are golden brown. Pour the honey glaze over the seared chicken breasts in the skillet, making sure to coat them evenly. Transfer the skillet to the preheated oven and bake for about 15-20 minutes, or until the chicken is cooked through and reaches an internal temperature of 165°F (74°C). While the chicken is baking, baste it occasionally with the honey glaze from the skillet. Once the chicken is cooked, remove the skillet from the oven. Let the chicken rest for a few minutes to allow the juices to redistribute. Drizzle some of the remaining honey glaze from the skillet over the chicken. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley for added freshness and flavor. Serve the Honey Glazed Chicken hot. Serve with your choice of sides such as steamed vegetables, roasted potatoes, or a fresh salad.

Ingredients: eggplant,    zucchini,    yellow and red bell peppers,    tomatoes,    onion,    garlic,    olive oil,    basil,    thyme,    salt and pepper,    tomato paste,    dried oregano
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large baking dish, combine the diced eggplant, diced zucchini, sliced yellow and red bell peppers, sliced onion, minced garlic, and diced tomatoes. Drizzle the olive oil over the vegetables and toss them to coat evenly. Add the tomato paste, dried thyme, dried oregano, salt, and pepper to the baking dish. Toss everything together until the vegetables are well coated with the seasoning. Spread the vegetables out in an even layer in the baking dish. Cover the dish with aluminum foil and place it in the preheated oven. Bake for about 40-45 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender and lightly browned. Remove the dish from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes. Garnish with fresh chopped basil leaves for added freshness and flavor. Serve the Ratatouille warm as a main course.

Ingredients: Firm tofu,    quinoa,    bell peppers,    zucchini,    red onion,    olive oil,    lemon juice,    garlic powder,    paprika,    salt,    and pepper
Instructions: Drain and press tofu to remove excess moisture. Cut tofu into slices and marinate in a mixture of olive oil, lemon juice, garlic powder, paprika, salt, and pepper. Cook tofu on a grill or stovetop until lightly charred. In a separate pan, roast bell peppers, zucchini, and red onion with olive oil, salt, and pepper. Cook quinoa according to package instructions. Serve grilled tofu over quinoa with roasted vegetables.

Ingredients: Brown lentils,    onion,    garlic,    ginger,    curry powder,    turmeric,    cumin,    coconut milk,    diced tomatoes,    vegetable broth,    lemon juice,    cilantro,    cooked brown rice
Instructions: Cook brown lentils according to package instructions. In a large pan, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add curry powder, turmeric, and cumin, and cook for another minute. Add cooked lentils, coconut milk, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and cilantro. Serve the lentil curry over cooked brown rice.

Ingredients: Bell peppers,    mushrooms,    spinach,    cooked quinoa,    onion,    garlic,    mozzarella cheese,    tomato sauce,    olive oil,    salt,    and pepper
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the tops off the bell peppers and remove the seeds. In a pan, sauté mushrooms, spinach, onion, and garlic with olive oil until softened. Stir in cooked quinoa, salt, and pepper. Stuff the bell peppers with the mixture and place them in a baking dish. Pour tomato sauce over the stuffed peppers and sprinkle with mozzarella cheese. Bake for 25-30 minutes until the peppers are tender and the cheese is melted and golden.

Ingredients: Chickpeas,    bell peppers,    broccoli,    carrots,    snap peas,    garlic,    ginger,    soy sauce,    sesame oil,    cooked quinoa
Instructions: In a large pan or wok, sauté garlic and ginger in sesame oil until fragrant. Add bell peppers, broccoli, carrots, and snap peas. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp. Stir in cooked chickpeas and soy sauce. Cook for another 2-3 minutes. Serve the stir-fry over cooked quinoa.

Recipe Title: Aglio e Olio with Grilled Shrimp
Ingredients: Spaghetti,    shrimp,    garlic,    red pepper flakes,    olive oil,    parsley,    Parmesan cheese,    salt,    and pepper
Instructions: Cook spaghetti according to package instructions. In a separate pan, grill shrimp with olive oil, salt, and pepper until cooked through. In a large skillet, sauté minced garlic and red pepper flakes in olive oil until fragrant. Toss cooked spaghetti with the garlic oil mixture. Add chopped parsley and grated Parmesan cheese, and toss again. Serve the spaghetti topped with grilled shrimp.

Ingredients: Brown lentils,    carrots,    celery,    onion,    garlic,    vegetable broth,    diced tomatoes,    bay leaves,    thyme,    paprika,    salt,    and pepper
Instructions: In a large pot, sauté onion, garlic, carrots, and celery until softened. Add lentils, vegetable broth, diced tomatoes, bay leaves, thyme, paprika, salt, and pepper. Bring to a boil and then reduce heat to a simmer. Cook for 30-40 minutes until the lentils are tender. Remove the bay leaves before serving.

Ingredients: Firm tofu,    broccoli,    bell peppers,    carrots,    snap peas,    garlic,    ginger,    teriyaki sauce,    sesame oil,    cooked rice or noodles
Instructions: Press tofu to remove excess moisture and cut into cubes. In a large skillet or wok, sauté garlic and ginger in sesame oil until fragrant. Add tofu and cook until lightly browned. Add broccoli, bell peppers, carrots, and snap peas. Cook until vegetables are tender-crisp. Stir in teriyaki sauce and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Serve the stir-fry over cooked rice or noodles

Ingredients: Eggplant,    chickpeas,    onion,    garlic,    ginger,    curry powder,    turmeric,    cumin,    coconut milk,    diced tomatoes,    vegetable broth,    lemon juice,    cilantro,    cooked rice or naan bread
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Cut the eggplant into cubes and roast in the oven for 15-20 minutes until softened. In a large pan, sauté onion, garlic, and ginger until fragrant. Add curry powder, turmeric, and cumin, and cook for another minute. Add roasted eggplant, chickpeas, coconut milk, diced tomatoes, and vegetable broth. Simmer for 15-20 minutes. Stir in lemon juice and cilantro. Serve the curry over cooked rice or with naan bread.

Ingredients: Portobello mushrooms,    fresh mozzarella cheese,    tomatoes,    fresh basil,    balsamic glaze,    olive oil,    salt,    and pepper
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Remove the stems from the portobello mushrooms and gently scrape out the gills. Brush the mushrooms with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Place the mushrooms on a baking sheet and bake for 10 minutes. Remove from the oven and stuff each mushroom with slices of mozzarella cheese, tomato slices, and fresh basil leaves. Return to the oven and bake for another 5-7 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Drizzle with balsamic glaze before serving.

Ingredients: Black beans,    sweet potatoes,    onion,    garlic,    cumin,    chili powder,    enchilada sauce,    tortillas,    shredded cheese (or vegan cheese),    cilantro,    avocado (optional)
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Peel and dice the sweet potatoes and steam or boil until tender. In a pan, sauté onion and garlic until softened. Add black beans, cooked sweet potatoes, cumin, and chili powder. Mash the mixture slightly. Warm the tortillas to make them pliable. Place a spoonful of the bean and sweet potato mixture on each tortilla and roll it up. Place the enchiladas in a baking dish and pour enchilada sauce over them. Sprinkle with shredded cheese or vegan cheese. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Garnish with cilantro and serve with avocado if desired.

Ingredients: Cauliflower rice,    mixed vegetables (carrots,    peas,    corn),    onion,    garlic,    soy sauce (or tamari for gluten-free),    sesame oil,    scrambled eggs (optional for non-vegan),    green onions,    sesame seeds
Instructions: In a large skillet or wok, sauté onion and garlic in sesame oil until softened. Add the mixed vegetables and cook until tender. Push the vegetables to one side and add the cauliflower rice to the other side of the pan. Cook for a few minutes until the cauliflower rice is heated through. If desired, push the cauliflower rice to the side and scramble the eggs in the empty space. Mix everything together, add soy sauce (or tamari), and cook for another 2-3 minutes. Garnish with chopped green onions and sesame seeds.

Ingredients: Zucchini,    cooked quinoa,    onion,    garlic,    bell peppers,    cherry tomatoes,    black beans,    corn,    cumin,    chili powder,    shredded cheese (or vegan cheese),    cilantro
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Cut the zucchini in half lengthwise and scoop out the seeds to create a hollow center. In a pan, sauté onion, garlic, bell peppers, cherry tomatoes, black beans, and corn until softened. Stir in cooked quinoa, cumin, and chili powder. Fill the zucchini halves with the quinoa mixture and place them in a baking dish. Sprinkle with shredded cheese or vegan cheese. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the cheese is melted and bubbly. Garnish with fresh cilantro before serving.

Ingredients: Shrimp,    mixed salad greens,    cherry tomatoes,    avocado,    red onion,    lemon juice,    olive oil,    Dijon mustard,    salt,    and pepper
Instructions: Cook the shrimp in boiling water or sauté in a pan until cooked through. In a large bowl, toss mixed salad greens, cherry tomatoes, diced avocado, and thinly sliced red onion. In a separate small bowl, whisk together lemon juice, olive oil, Dijon mustard, salt, and pepper to make the dressing. Drizzle the dressing over the salad and top with cooked shrimp.

Ingredients: Rice noodles,    tofu,    carrots,    bell peppers,    bean sprouts,    green onions,    garlic,    tamarind paste,    lime juice,    tamari or soy sauce,    brown sugar,    peanuts,    cilantro
Instructions: Cook the rice noodles according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Press tofu to remove excess moisture and cut into small cubes. In a large pan or wok, sauté tofu in a bit of oil until lightly browned. Add thinly sliced carrots, bell peppers, bean sprouts, minced garlic, and chopped green onions. Stir-fry until the vegetables are tender-crisp. In a small bowl, whisk together tamarind paste, lime juice, tamari or soy sauce, and brown sugar to make the sauce. Add the cooked rice noodles and sauce to the pan with the vegetables and tofu. Toss everything together until well coated. Serve with crushed peanuts and fresh cilantro on top.

Ingredients: Arborio rice,    mushrooms,    spinach,    onion,    garlic,    vegetable broth,    white wine (optional),    Parmesan cheese (or vegan cheese),    butter (or vegan butter),    thyme,    salt,    and pepper.
Instructions: In a large pot, sauté chopped onion and minced garlic in butter (or vegan butter) until softened. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their moisture. Stir in Arborio rice and cook for a few minutes until it becomes translucent. If using, add white wine and cook until it evaporates. Begin adding vegetable broth, one ladle at a time, stirring constantly and allowing the liquid to be absorbed before adding more. Continue this process until the rice is cooked and creamy. Stir in chopped spinach, Parmesan cheese (or vegan cheese), thyme, salt, and pepper. Cook for another minute until the spinach wilts. Serve the risotto hot.

Ingredients: Tortillas,    black beans,    bell peppers,    onion,    corn,    cherry tomatoes,    avocado,    lime juice,    cilantro,    cumin,    chili powder,    garlic powder,    salt,    and pepper.
Instructions: In a pan, sauté sliced bell peppers and onion until softened. Add black beans, corn, cherry tomatoes, cumin, chili powder, garlic powder, salt, and pepper. Cook for a few minutes until heated through. Warm the tortillas. Fill each tortilla with the veggie mixture. Top with diced avocado, a squeeze of lime juice, and chopped cilantro.

Ingredients: Lentils,    potatoes,    carrots,    peas,    onion,    garlic,    vegetable broth,    tomato paste,    soy sauce (or tamari for gluten-free),    thyme,    rosemary,    salt,    and pepper.
Instructions: Cook the potatoes until tender, then mash them with a bit of salt and pepper. In a separate pot, sauté chopped onion and minced garlic until softened. Add diced carrots, peas, lentils, tomato paste, vegetable broth, soy sauce (or tamari), thyme, rosemary, salt, and pepper. Simmer for 15-20 minutes until the lentils and vegetables are cooked. Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). Transfer the lentil mixture to a baking dish and spread the mashed potatoes on top. Bake for 20-25 minutes until the top is golden brown. Serve hot.

Ingredients: Jackfruit (canned or fresh),    BBQ sauce,    onion,    garlic,    brown sugar,    apple cider vinegar,    coleslaw mix,    buns
Instructions: Drain and rinse the jackfruit if using canned. If using fresh, remove the skin and seeds and cut into chunks. In a pan, sauté chopped onion and minced garlic until softened. Add the jackfruit and break it apart with a fork. Stir in BBQ sauce, brown sugar, and apple cider vinegar. Cook for 10-15 minutes until the jackfruit is tender and has absorbed the flavors. In a separate bowl, mix coleslaw mix with a bit of BBQ sauce for added flavor. Toast the buns if desired. Assemble the sandwich by placing the BBQ jackfruit on the bottom bun and topping it with coleslaw. Serve hot.

Ingredients: Cauliflower,    onion,    garlic,    ginger,    curry powder,    turmeric,    cumin,    coconut milk,    tomato paste,    vegetable broth,    chickpeas,    cilantro,    lime wedges
Instructions: In a large pan, sauté chopped onion, minced garlic, and grated ginger until fragrant. Add curry powder, turmeric, and cumin. Stir for a minute until the spices release their flavors. Add cauliflower florets, coconut milk, tomato paste, and vegetable broth. Bring to a simmer and cook until the cauliflower is tender. Add drained and rinsed chickpeas and cook for a few more minutes until heated through. Serve the cauliflower curry with steamed rice or naan bread. Garnish with fresh cilantro and lime wedges.

Ingredients: Brown lentils,    zucchini,    onion,    garlic,    carrots,    celery,    crushed tomatoes,    tomato paste,    vegetable broth,    dried oregano,    dried basil,    red pepper flakes,    olive oil,    salt,    and pepper.
Instructions: In a pot, cook the brown lentils according to package instructions. Drain and set aside. Using a spiralizer or vegetable peeler, turn the zucchini into noodles. In a separate pan, sauté chopped onion, minced garlic, grated carrots, and diced celery until softened. Add crushed tomatoes, tomato paste, vegetable broth, dried oregano, dried basil, and red pepper flakes. Simmer for 15-20 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Stir in the cooked lentils. In a separate pan, heat a bit of olive oil and sauté the zucchini noodles until they reach the desired tenderness. Serve the lentil Bolognese sauce over the zucchini noodles.

Ingredients: Portobello mushrooms,    buns,    Swiss cheese (or vegan cheese),    spinach,    tomato slices,    red onion slices,    Dijon mustard,    balsamic glaze (optional),    salt,    and pepper
Instructions: Clean the Portobello mushrooms and remove the stems. In a bowl, mix olive oil, salt, and pepper. Brush the mushrooms with the mixture. Grill the mushrooms for about 4-5 minutes on each side until they are tender. Optional: Place a slice of Swiss cheese on top of each mushroom during the last minute of grilling. Toast the buns if desired. Assemble the burgers by spreading Dijon mustard on the buns and layering the Portobello mushroom, spinach, tomato slices, and red onion slices. Drizzle balsamic glaze on top if desired.

Ingredients: Tomatoes,    fresh mozzarella cheese,    fresh basil leaves,    balsamic glaze,    olive oil,    salt,    and pepper
Instructions: Slice the tomatoes and fresh mozzarella cheese into rounds. Arrange the tomato slices and mozzarella slices on a plate, alternating them. Tuck fresh basil leaves between the tomato and cheese slices. Drizzle balsamic glaze and olive oil over the salad. Season with salt and pepper to taste

Ingredients: Salmon fillets,    teriyaki sauce,    honey,    garlic,    ginger,    green onions,    sesame seeds,    steamed rice,    steamed broccoli
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). In a bowl, mix teriyaki sauce, honey, minced garlic, grated ginger, and sliced green onions. Place the salmon fillets in a baking dish and pour the teriyaki sauce mixture over them. Bake for 15-20 minutes until the salmon is cooked to your desired doneness. Sprinkle sesame seeds on top. Serve the teriyaki salmon with steamed rice and steamed broccoli.

Ingredients: Arborio rice,    mushrooms (such as cremini or shiitake),    onion,    garlic,    vegetable broth,    white wine (optional),    Parmesan cheese (or vegan substitute),    butter (or vegan substitute),    parsley,    salt,    and pepper
Instructions: In a pot, heat vegetable broth and keep it warm on low heat. In a separate pan, sauté chopped onion and minced garlic until softened. Add sliced mushrooms and cook until they release their liquid and start to brown. Add Arborio rice to the pan and stir for a minute to coat it with the oil. Optional: Add white wine and cook until it evaporates. Gradually add the warm vegetable broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring continuously until the liquid is absorbed before adding the next ladleful. Continue this process until the rice is cooked al dente and creamy. Stir in grated Parmesan cheese and butter until melted. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish with chopped parsley before serving.

Ingredients: Oats,  almond milk,  fruits,  nuts,  honey
Instructions: Cook oats with almond milk, top with fruits, nuts, and honey

Ingredients: Gluten-free flour,  bananas,  almond milk,  baking powder,  vanilla extract,  maple syrup
Instructions: Mix the ingredients, cook the pancakes on a griddle, and serve with maple syrup.

Ingredients: Cooked quinoa,  mixed berries,  almond milk,  honey,  chia seeds,  sliced almonds
Instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl and enjoy.

Ingredients: Eggs,  bell peppers,  onions,  spinach,  tomatoes,  salt,  pepper
Instructions: Beat the eggs, sauté the vegetables, add the eggs, cook until set, and fold into an omelette.

Ingredients: Gluten-free granola,  dairy-free yogurt,  mixed berries,  honey
Instructions: Layer the ingredients in a glass, starting with the granola, then yogurt, berries, and drizzle with honey.

Ingredients: Chia seeds,  almond milk,  mixed berries,  honey
Instructions: Mix chia seeds and almond milk, refrigerate overnight, layer with mixed berries, and drizzle with honey.

Ingredients: Gluten-free flour,  zucchini,  almond milk,  maple syrup,  vanilla extract,  baking powder
Instructions: Mix the ingredients, pour into muffin cups, and bake until golden brown.

Ingredients: Mixed fruits (banana,  berries,  mango),  almond milk,  honey
Instructions: Blend the fruits, almond milk, and honey until smooth.

Ingredients: Grilled chicken breast,  mixed greens,  cherry tomatoes,  cucumber,  red onion,  balsamic vinaigrette
Instructions: Grill the chicken, chop it, and toss with mixed greens, tomatoes, cucumber, onion, and dressing.

Ingredients: Cooked quinoa,  black beans,  corn,  bell peppers,  red onion,  cilantro,  lime juice,  olive oil,  salt,  pepper
Instructions: Combine all the ingredients in a bowl, toss with lime juice, olive oil, salt, and pepper.

Ingredients: Green lentils,  vegetable broth,  carrots,  celery,  onion,  garlic,  cumin,  paprika,  salt,  pepper
Instructions: Cook lentils, sauté vegetables, add lentils, broth, and spices. Simmer until the flavors blend.

Ingredients: Grilled chicken breast,  gluten-free wrap,  mixed greens,  avocado,  tomato,  dairy-free ranch dressing
Instructions: Fill the wrap with chicken, greens, avocado, tomato, and dressing. Roll it up tightly.

Ingredients: Gluten-free pasta,  mixed vegetables (broccoli,  bell peppers,  carrots),  olive oil,  garlic,  salt,  pepper
Instructions: 1. Cook the gluten-free pasta according to package instructions. 2. In a large skillet, heat some olive oil over medium heat. 3. Add minced garlic and sauté for a minute until fragrant. 4. Add the mixed vegetables (broccoli, bell peppers, carrots) to the skillet and sauté until they are tender-crisp. 5. Season with salt and pepper to taste. 6. Drain the cooked pasta and add it to the skillet with the sautéed vegetables. 7. Drizzle with some olive oil and toss everything together until well combined. 8. Cook for another minute or two to heat everything through. 9. Serve the dairy-free pasta primavera hot and enjoy!

Ingredients: Salmon fillet,  mixed vegetables (zucchini,  bell peppers,  asparagus),  olive oil,  lemon juice,  salt,  pepper
Instructions: Grill the salmon and roast the vegetables with olive oil, lemon juice, salt, and pepper.

Ingredients: Ground turkey,  black beans,  diced tomatoes,  onion,  garlic,  chili powder,  cumin,  salt,  pepper
Instructions: 1. Sauté the ground turkey, onion, and garlic. 2. Add black beans, diced tomatoes, chili powder, cumin, salt, and pepper. 3. Simmer the mixture until the flavors blend.

Ingredients: Mixed vegetables (broccoli,  bell peppers,  carrots,  snow peas),  tofu,  gluten-free soy sauce,  sesame oil,  ginger,  garlic,  cornstarch
Instructions: Stir-fry the vegetables, tofu, ginger, and garlic. Mix soy sauce, sesame oil, and cornstarch. Add the sauce to the stir-fry.

Ingredients: Veggie patty,  gluten-free bun,  lettuce,  tomato,  red onion,  pickles,  ketchup,  mustard
Instructions: Grill the veggie patty, assemble it on the bun with lettuce, tomato, onion, pickles, ketchup, and mustard.

Ingredients: Chicken breast,  coconut milk,  curry paste,  onion,  garlic,  ginger,  bell peppers,  carrots,  cilantro,  lime juice,  salt
Instructions: Sauté chicken, onion, garlic, ginger, and spices. Add coconut milk, vegetables, and simmer until cooked. Garnish with cilantro and lime juice.

Ingredients: Shrimp,  mixed vegetables (broccoli,  bell peppers,  snap peas),  gluten-free soy sauce,  garlic,  ginger,  cornstarch,  sesame oil
Instructions: Sauté shrimp, vegetables, garlic, and ginger. Mix soy sauce, cornstarch, and water. Add the sauce to the stir-fry. Drizzle with sesame oil.

Ingredients: Beef strips,  mixed vegetables (broccoli,  bell peppers,  carrots,  mushrooms),  gluten-free soy sauce,  garlic,  ginger,  cornstarch,  sesame oil
Instructions: Stir-fry beef, vegetables, garlic, and ginger. Mix soy sauce, cornstarch, and water. Add the sauce to the stir-fry. Drizzle with sesame oil.

Ingredients: Gluten-free lasagna noodles,  mixed vegetables (spinach,  zucchini,  bell peppers),  marinara sauce,  dairy-free cheese,  Italian seasoning
Instructions: Layer noodles, vegetables, sauce, and cheese. Repeat the layers. Bake until bubbly and golden.

Ingredients: Gluten-free flour,  ripe bananas,  sugar,  oil,  vanilla extract,  baking powder,  cinnamon,  salt
Instructions: Mash bananas, mix with sugar, oil, and vanilla. Add flour, baking powder, cinnamon, and salt. Bake until golden.

Ingredients: Gluten-free flour,  dairy-free chocolate chips,  sugar,  oil,  vanilla extract,  baking powder,  salt
Instructions: Mix flour, sugar, oil, vanilla, baking powder, and salt. Stir in chocolate chips. Bake until golden brown.

Ingredients: Rolled oats,  nut butter,  honey,  dairy-free chocolate chips,  chia seeds,  vanilla extract
Instructions: Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Roll into balls and refrigerate until firm.

Ingredients: Popcorn kernels,  dairy-free butter substitute,  salt
Instructions: Pop the popcorn kernels in a covered pot. Melt the dairy-free butter substitute and drizzle over the popcorn. Sprinkle with salt.

Ingredients: Frozen mixed berries,  banana,  almond milk,  spinach,  chia seeds,  granola
Instructions: Blend berries, banana, almond milk, and spinach. Pour into a bowl, top with chia seeds and granola.

Ingredients: Gluten-free bread,  avocado,  lemon juice,  salt,  pepper,  red pepper flakes
Instructions: Toast the bread, mash avocado with lemon juice, salt, and pepper. Spread on toast, sprinkle with red pepper flakes.

Ingredients: Chia seeds,  almond milk,  maple syrup,  vanilla extract,  fresh fruit
Instructions: Mix chia seeds, almond milk, maple syrup, and vanilla extract. Let it sit overnight. Serve with fresh fruit.

Ingredients: Quinoa,  mixed vegetables (cucumber,  cherry tomatoes,  bell peppers),  black beans,  lemon juice,  olive oil,  fresh herbs
Instructions: Cook quinoa, toss with vegetables, beans, lemon juice, olive oil, and herbs. Serve chilled.

Ingredients: Sushi rice,  nori sheets,  vegetables (cucumber,  avocado,  carrots),  cooked shrimp or crab (optional),  soy sauce,  wasabi,  pickled ginger
Instructions: Prepare sushi rice. Lay a nori sheet, spread rice, add vegetables and shrimp/crab, roll tightly. Slice and serve with soy sauce, wasabi, and ginger.

Ingredients: Salmon fillet,  lemon juice,  olive oil,  herbs,  salt,  pepper
Instructions: Marinate salmon with lemon juice, olive oil, herbs, salt, and pepper. Bake until cooked through.

Ingredients: Chicken breast,  mixed vegetables (broccoli,  bell peppers,  carrots,  mushrooms),  gluten-free soy sauce,  garlic,  ginger,  cornstarch,  sesame oil
Instructions: Stir-fry chicken, vegetables, garlic, and ginger. Mix soy sauce, cornstarch, and water. Add the sauce to the stir-fry. Drizzle with sesame oil.

Ingredients: Mixed vegetables (cauliflower,  peas,  carrots,  bell peppers),  coconut milk,  curry powder,  onion,  garlic,  ginger,  rice
Instructions: Sauté onion, garlic, and ginger. Add vegetables, coconut milk, and curry powder. Simmer until vegetables are tender. Serve with rice.

Ingredients: Ground beef (or plant-based meat substitute),  gluten-free spaghetti,  diced tomatoes,  tomato paste,  onion,  garlic,  Italian seasoning,  olive oil
Instructions: Sauté onion and garlic. Add ground beef and cook until browned. Stir in diced tomatoes, tomato paste, and seasoning. Serve over cooked spaghetti.

Ingredients: Dairy-free yogurt,  mixed berries,  gluten-free granola,  honey
Instructions: Layer yogurt, berries, and granola in a glass. Drizzle with honey. Repeat layers. Serve chilled.

Ingredients: Assorted nuts (almonds,  cashews,  walnuts),  dried fruits (raisins,  cranberries),  gluten-free pretzels,  dairy-free chocolate chips
Instructions: Mix all ingredients in a bowl. Serve as a snack or on-the-go.

Ingredients: Rice cakes,  avocado,  lemon juice,  salt,  pepper,  red pepper flakes
Instructions: Spread avocado on rice cakes, sprinkle with lemon juice, salt, pepper, and red pepper flakes.

Ingredients: Chickpeas,  tahini,  lemon juice,  garlic,  olive oil,  mixed vegetables (carrot sticks,  cucumber slices,  bell pepper strips)
Instructions: Blend chickpeas, tahini, lemon juice, garlic, and olive oil to make hummus. Serve with vegetable sticks.

Ingredients: Celery stalks,  peanut butter
Instructions: Spread peanut butter onto celery stalks and enjoy.

Ingredients: Greek yogurt,  mixed berries (such as strawberries,  blueberries,  and raspberries)
Instructions: Serve Greek yogurt in a bowl and top with mixed berries.

Ingredients: Cucumber,  hummus
Instructions: Slice cucumbers and serve with a side of hummus for dipping.

Ingredients: eggs,  pale ale beer,  apple cider vinegar,  kosher salt,  sugar,  black peppercorns,  bay leaf
Instructions: In a medium saucepan, combine the pale ale beer, apple cider vinegar, kosher salt, sugar, black peppercorns, and bay leaf. Bring the mixture to a boil over medium heat, stirring occasionally to dissolve the salt and sugar. Once the mixture reaches a boil, remove it from heat and let it cool to room temperature. While the brine is cooling, place the eggs in a saucepan and add enough water to cover them. Bring the water to a gentle boil over medium heat and cook the eggs for about 8-10 minutes for a medium-hard yolk or 10-12 minutes for a firm yolk. Once the eggs are cooked, carefully transfer them to an ice bath to cool and stop the cooking process. Once the brine has cooled, strain out the solids and transfer the liquid to a container large enough to hold the eggs and the brine. Gently place the cooled hard-boiled eggs into the brine, making sure they are fully submerged. Cover the container and refrigerate for at least 24 hours to allow the flavors to develop and the eggs to absorb the brine. After 24 hours, remove the eggs from the brine and pat them dry with a paper towel before serving.

Ingredients: Apple,  almond butter
Instructions: Slice apples and serve with a side of almond butter for dipping.

Ingredients: Greek yogurt,  granola,  mixed berries (such as strawberries,  blueberries,  and raspberries)
Instructions: Layer Greek yogurt, granola, and mixed berries in a glass or bowl.

Ingredients: Cherry tomatoes,  mozzarella cheese
Instructions: Skewer cherry tomatoes and mozzarella balls onto toothpicks and serve.

Ingredients: Canned chickpeas,  olive oil,  salt,  spices (such as paprika,  cumin,  or chili powder)
Instructions: Rinse and dry chickpeas. Toss with olive oil, salt, and desired spices. Roast in the oven until crispy.

Ingredients: Peaches,  cottage cheese
Instructions: Slice peaches and serve with a side of cottage cheese.

Ingredients: Cucumber,  Tajin seasoning (chili lime seasoning)
Instructions: Slice cucumber and sprinkle with Tajin seasoning to taste.

Ingredients: Kale leaves,  olive oil,  salt
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°F (175°C). Remove kale leaves from the stem, toss with olive oil and salt, and bake until crispy.

Ingredients: cauliflower,  all-purpose flour,  paprika,  garlic powder,  salt,  black pepper,  beer (such as pale ale or lager),  vegetable oil for frying,  tortillas,  shredded lettuce,  diced tomatoes,  sliced avocado,  vegan sour cream,  chopped cilantro
Instructions: In a large bowl, whisk together the flour, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Slowly pour in the beer, whisking constantly, until a smooth batter forms. Let the batter rest for 10 minutes. In a deep pot or skillet, heat about 2 inches of vegetable oil over medium-high heat until it reaches 350°F (175°C). Dip the cauliflower florets into the batter, allowing any excess batter to drip off. Carefully place the battered cauliflower into the hot oil, working in batches, and fry until golden brown and crispy, about 3-4 minutes per batch. Remove with a slotted spoon and transfer to a paper towel-lined plate to drain excess oil. Warm the tortillas in a dry skillet or microwave. Assemble the tacos by filling each tortilla with a generous amount of beer-battered cauliflower and topping with shredded lettuce, diced tomatoes, sliced avocado, vegan sour cream, and chopped cilantro. Serve the Beer-Battered Cauliflower Tacos immediately.

Ingredients: cremini mushrooms,  onion,  garlic,  carrots,  tomato paste,  red wine,  vegetable broth,  all-purpose flour,  olive oil,  soy sauce,  dried thyme,  salt and pepper,  fresh parsley
Instructions: In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and carrots, and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they start to release their moisture and shrink in size, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the mushroom mixture and stir to coat evenly. Cook for another minute to cook off the raw flour taste. Add the tomato paste, red wine, vegetable broth, soy sauce, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir well to combine all the ingredients. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened and the flavors have melded together. While the sauce is simmering, prepare your choice of side dish, such as mashed potatoes or pasta. Once the sauce has thickened, taste and adjust the seasoning if needed. Serve the Mushroom Bourguignon over your preferred side dish and garnish with freshly chopped parsley.

Ingredients: arborio rice,  vegetable broth,  dry white wine,  onion,  garlic,  mushrooms,  peas,  olive oil,  salt and pepper,  fresh parsley
Instructions: In a large saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and cook for another minute. Add the sliced mushrooms to the saucepan and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown, about 5-7 minutes. Add the Arborio rice to the saucepan and stir to coat the grains with the oil and mushroom mixture. Cook for about 1 minute until the rice becomes slightly translucent. Pour in the white wine and stir continuously until it is absorbed by the rice. Begin adding the vegetable broth, one ladleful at a time, stirring constantly and allowing the rice to absorb the liquid before adding more. Continue this process until the rice is cooked al dente, tender but still slightly firm to the bite. This should take about 20-25 minutes. Stir in the frozen peas and cook for another 2-3 minutes until the peas are heated through. Season the risotto with salt and pepper to taste. The consistency should be creamy and the rice grains should still have some texture. Remove the risotto from the heat and let it rest for a few minutes. Serve the White Wine Risotto with Mushrooms and Peas in individual bowls or plates. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley.

Ingredients: tofu,  mushrooms,  onion,  garlic,  carrots,  red wine,  vegetable broth,  tomato paste,  olive oil,  all-purpose flour,  soy sauce,  Dijon mustard,  dried thyme,  salt and pepper,  fresh parsley
Instructions: In a large skillet or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the onions and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the garlic and carrots, and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the seitan or tofu chunks to the skillet and cook until lightly browned, about 5 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the mixture and stir to coat evenly. Cook for another minute to cook off the raw flour taste. Add the mushrooms, red wine, vegetable broth, tomato paste, soy sauce, Dijon mustard, dried thyme, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir well to combine all the ingredients. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 45 minutes to 1 hour, or until the flavors have melded together and the sauce has thickened. While the Coq au Vin simmers, prepare your choice of side dish, such as mashed potatoes or crusty bread. Once the sauce has thickened and the flavors have developed, taste and adjust the seasoning if needed. Serve the Coq au Vin in individual bowls or plates. Garnish with fresh chopped parsley.

Ingredients: raw cashews,  onion,  garlic,  carrots,  celery,  vegetable broth,  beer,  yeast,  Dijon mustard,  soy sauce,  smoked paprika,  salt and pepper,  fresh chives
Instructions: In a large pot, heat some olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion, minced garlic, diced carrots, and diced celery. Sauté until the vegetables are softened, about 5 minutes. In a blender, combine the soaked and drained cashews with the vegetable broth. Blend until smooth and creamy. Add the cashew mixture, beer, nutritional yeast, Dijon mustard, soy sauce, smoked paprika, salt, and pepper to the pot with the sautéed vegetables. Stir well to combine. Bring the soup to a simmer over medium heat, then reduce the heat to low. Let it simmer gently for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally. After 30 minutes, taste the soup and adjust the seasonings if needed. Ladle the Vegan Beer Cheese Soup into bowls and garnish with freshly chopped chives.

Ingredients: mushrooms,  onion,  garlic,  carrots,  olive oil,  all-purpose flour,  vegetable broth,  stout beer,  tomato paste,  soy sauce,  thyme leaves,  salt and pepper,  vegan puff pastry,  plant-based milk
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and sauté until translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the minced garlic and carrots, and cook for another 2 minutes. Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown, about 5-7 minutes. Sprinkle the flour over the mushroom mixture and stir to coat evenly. Cook for another minute to cook off the raw flour taste. In a small bowl, whisk together the vegetable broth, stout beer, tomato paste, soy sauce, thyme leaves, salt, and pepper. Pour the mixture into the skillet and stir well to combine. Reduce the heat to low and let the mixture simmer for about 10 minutes, or until the sauce has thickened. Transfer the mushroom mixture to a baking dish. Roll out the thawed puff pastry sheet on a lightly floured surface to fit the size of your baking dish. Place the puff pastry over the mushroom filling, pressing the edges to seal. Brush the top of the puff pastry with plant-based milk to give it a golden-brown color when baked. Using a knife, make a few slits on the top of the puff pastry to allow steam to escape during baking. Place the Mushroom and Stout Pie in the preheated oven and bake for about 25-30 minutes, or until the puff pastry is golden and crispy. Once baked, remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Ingredients: quinoa,  mango,  red bell pepper,  red onion,  jalapeno pepper,  fresh cilantro,  fresh lime juice,  olive oil,  tequila,  agave nectar (or maple syrup),  salt and pepper
Instructions: Rinse the quinoa under cold water in a fine-mesh sieve to remove any bitterness. Drain well. In a medium saucepan, bring the water to a boil. Add the rinsed quinoa and reduce the heat to low. Cover and simmer for about 15 minutes, or until the quinoa is tender and the water is absorbed. Remove from heat and let it cool. In a large mixing bowl, combine the cooked and cooled quinoa, diced mango, diced red bell pepper, diced red onion, chopped jalapeno pepper, and chopped cilantro. Toss gently to mix. In a small bowl, whisk together the fresh lime juice, olive oil, tequila, agave nectar, salt, and pepper. Pour the dressing over the quinoa salad and toss until well coated. Let the Mango Margarita Quinoa Salad sit at room temperature for about 15 minutes to allow the flavors to meld together. Serve the salad chilled or at room temperature.

Ingredients: olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  mushrooms,  arborio rice,  red wine,  vegetable broth,  frozen peas,  yeast,  fresh parsley,  salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: In a large skillet or saucepan, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown, about 7-8 minutes. Stir in the Arborio rice and cook for 1-2 minutes, stirring constantly, until the rice grains are coated in the oil and slightly toasted. Pour in the red wine and cook, stirring frequently, until the wine is absorbed by the rice. Begin adding the warm vegetable broth to the skillet, one ladleful at a time. Stir continuously and allow each ladleful of broth to be absorbed by the rice before adding the next. Continue this process until all the broth has been used and the rice is cooked al dente, about 20-25 minutes. Stir in the frozen peas and nutritional yeast. Cook for another 2-3 minutes, until the peas are heated through. Remove the skillet from the heat. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Garnish the Mushroom and Red Wine Risotto with fresh chopped parsley.

Ingredients: sweet potatoes,  olive oil,  maple syrup,  bourbon,  cinnamon,  nutmeg,  salt,  pecans
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 400°F (200°C). Wash and scrub the sweet potatoes, then pat them dry. Pierce each sweet potato several times with a fork. Place the sweet potatoes on a baking sheet and drizzle them with olive oil. Rub the oil over the potatoes to evenly coat them. Bake the sweet potatoes in the preheated oven for 40-45 minutes, or until they are fork-tender. While the sweet potatoes are baking, prepare the bourbon glaze. In a small saucepan, combine the maple syrup, bourbon, ground cinnamon, ground nutmeg, and salt. Stir well to combine. Bring the glaze mixture to a simmer over medium heat. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the glaze has thickened slightly. Remove the sweet potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. Slice each sweet potato lengthwise, but not all the way through, creating a pocket. Spoon the bourbon glaze over each sweet potato, making sure to get the glaze into the sliced pockets. Return the glazed sweet potatoes to the oven for an additional 5 minutes, allowing the glaze to caramelize slightly. Remove the sweet potatoes from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. Optionally, sprinkle the Vegan Bourbon Glazed Sweet Potatoes with chopped pecans for added crunch and flavor.

Ingredients: potatoes,  olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  cabbage or kale,  vegetable broth,  almond or oat milk,  vegan butter,  Irish whiskey,  salt and pepper
Instructions: Place the peeled and cubed potatoes in a large pot of salted water. Bring the water to a boil and cook the potatoes until they are tender, about 15-20 minutes. Drain the potatoes and set them aside. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the shredded cabbage or kale to the skillet and cook until it wilts down, about 5-7 minutes. Pour in the vegetable broth and bring it to a simmer. Cover the skillet and let the cabbage or kale cook for an additional 10 minutes, or until it is tender. In a small saucepan, warm the plant-based milk over low heat. Mash the cooked potatoes with a potato masher or fork until smooth. Gradually add the warmed plant-based milk, vegan butter, Irish whiskey, salt, and pepper to the mashed potatoes. Mix well to combine. Add the cooked cabbage or kale mixture to the mashed potatoes and gently fold it in until well incorporated. Taste the Vegan Irish Colcannon and adjust the seasoning if needed.

Ingredients: strawberries,  red wine,  balsamic vinegar,  maple syrup or agave nectar,  extra-virgin olive oil,  salt,  black pepper,  mixed salad greens,  nuts
Instructions: In a blender or food processor, combine the chopped strawberries, red wine, balsamic vinegar, maple syrup or agave nectar, olive oil, salt, and black pepper. Blend until smooth and well combined. Taste the dressing and adjust the sweetness or acidity according to your preference. You can add more maple syrup/agave nectar for sweetness or more balsamic vinegar for acidity. Place the mixed salad greens in a large bowl or divide them among individual serving plates. Drizzle the strawberry wine dressing over the salad greens. Start with a small amount and add more as needed. Toss the salad gently to evenly coat the greens with the dressing. If desired, garnish the salad with sliced strawberries, nuts, or any other toppings of your choice.

Ingredients: olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  cremini mushrooms,  button mushrooms,  carrots,  celery,  red wine,  vegetable broth,  tomatoes,  tomato paste,  soy sauce or tamari,  dried thyme,  dried rosemary,  salt and pepper
Instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the sliced cremini mushrooms and button mushrooms to the pot. Cook until the mushrooms release their moisture and start to brown, about 7-8 minutes. Add the chopped carrots and celery to the pot. Sauté for another 5 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften. Pour in the red wine and bring it to a simmer. Allow the wine to cook for a few minutes to reduce slightly. Add the vegetable broth, diced tomatoes (with their juices), tomato paste, soy sauce or tamari, dried thyme, and dried rosemary to the pot. Stir well to combine. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Bring the stew to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot and let the stew simmer for about 30 minutes, or until the vegetables are tender. Serve the Vegan Mushroom and Red Wine Stew hot, with crusty bread or over cooked grains.

Ingredients: whiskey,  soy sauce or tamari,  maple syrup,  tomato paste,  garlic,  Dijon mustard,  smoked paprika,  tempeh,  bell pepper,  red onion,  cherry tomatoes,  olive oil,  salt and pepper,  skewers
Instructions: In a small bowl, whisk together all the ingredients for the whiskey glaze until well combined. Set aside. Place the cubed tempeh in a shallow dish and pour half of the whiskey glaze over it. Toss to coat the tempeh evenly. Cover and let it marinate in the refrigerator for at least 30 minutes (or overnight for more flavor). Preheat your grill or grill pan over medium-high heat. Thread the marinated tempeh, bell pepper chunks, red onion chunks, and cherry tomatoes onto the skewers, alternating the ingredients. Brush the skewers with olive oil and season with salt and pepper. Grill the skewers for about 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally and basting with the remaining whiskey glaze, until the tempeh is browned and the vegetables are tender. Remove the skewers from the grill and let them cool slightly before serving. Serve the Vegan Whiskey Glazed Tempeh Skewers as an appetizer or as a main dish with a side of rice or grilled vegetables.

Ingredients: olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  carrots,  celery,  red bell pepper,  green lentils,  tomatoes,  vegetable broth,  red wine,  smoked paprika,  dried thyme,  bay leaf,  salt and pepper
Instructions: In a large pot or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion is translucent, about 5 minutes. Add the diced carrots, celery, and red bell pepper to the pot. Sauté for another 5 minutes, until the vegetables begin to soften. Stir in the green lentils, diced tomatoes, vegetable broth, red wine, smoked paprika, dried thyme, bay leaf, salt, and pepper. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat to low. Cover the pot and let the stew simmer for about 30-35 minutes, or until the lentils are tender. Remove the bay leaf and adjust the seasoning if needed. Serve the Vegan Red Wine Lentil Stew hot, with crusty bread or over cooked grains.

Ingredients: olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  carrots,  celery,  frozen peas,  cooked brown lentils,  vegetable broth,  Guinness beer,  tomato paste,  Worcestershire sauce,  dried thyme,  dried rosemary,  salt and pepper,  mashed potatoes
Instructions: Preheat the oven to 375°F (190°C). In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the diced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent. Add the diced carrots and celery to the skillet and continue cooking for about 5 minutes, until the vegetables start to soften. Add the plant-based ground meat substitute or cooked lentils to the skillet and cook according to package instructions or until heated through. Stir in the frozen peas, vegetable broth, Guinness beer, tomato paste, vegan Worcestershire sauce, dried thyme, dried rosemary, salt, and pepper. Allow the mixture to simmer for about 10 minutes, until the flavors are well combined and the liquid has reduced slightly. Transfer the meat and vegetable mixture to a baking dish or individual ramekins. Spread the mashed potatoes evenly over the top of the filling, creating a smooth layer. Place the baking dish in the preheated oven and bake for 25-30 minutes, or until the mashed potatoes are golden brown and the filling is bubbling. Remove from the oven and let it cool for a few minutes before serving.

Ingredients: olive oil,  portobello mushrooms,  onion,  carrots,  garlic,  vegetable broth,  red wine,  tomato paste,  soy sauce or tamari,  all-purpose flour,  dried thyme,  salt and pepper
Instructions: In a large skillet or Dutch oven, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced portobello mushrooms and cook for about 5 minutes until they start to brown. Remove the mushrooms from the skillet and set aside. In the same skillet, add the diced onion, carrots, and minced garlic. Sauté for about 5 minutes until the vegetables begin to soften. In a small bowl, whisk together the vegetable broth, red wine, tomato paste, soy sauce, flour, dried thyme, salt, and pepper until well combined. Pour the liquid mixture into the skillet with the sautéed vegetables. Stir well to combine. Return the cooked portobello mushrooms to the skillet and stir to coat them with the sauce. Bring the mixture to a simmer. Reduce the heat to low, cover the skillet, and let it simmer for about 30 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the sauce thickens and the flavors meld together. Taste and adjust the seasoning with salt and pepper if needed. Serve the Portobello Mushroom Bourguignon hot, garnished with fresh chopped parsley. It pairs well with mashed potatoes, rice, or crusty bread.

Ingredients: olive oil,  all-purpose flour,  vegetable broth,  unsweetened almond milk,  mozzarella,  white wine,  salt and pepper to taste
Instructions: In a saucepan over medium heat, heat the olive oil. Add the flour and whisk continuously for 1-2 minutes until the mixture becomes smooth and lightly golden. Gradually pour in the vegetable broth while whisking continuously to prevent lumps from forming. Add the almond milk and continue whisking until the mixture thickens slightly. Reduce the heat to low and gradually add the shredded vegan cheese, stirring until melted and smooth. Stir in the white wine and continue cooking for another 2-3 minutes to incorporate the flavors. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Remove the soup from the heat and let it cool slightly. Using a blender or immersion blender, blend the soup until smooth and creamy. Transfer the soup to small shot glasses or serving bowls. Garnish each shooter with chopped fresh chives or green onions and crispy vegan bacon bits if desired. Serve the Vegan Cheese Soup Shooters as an appetizer or party snack, allowing guests to enjoy the creamy and cheesy flavors with a hint of white wine.

Ingredients: butternut squash,  olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  carrots,  celery,  vegetable broth,  white wine,  dried thyme,  cinnamon,  salt and pepper
Instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the diced onion, minced garlic, carrots, and celery. Sauté for about 5 minutes, until the vegetables are slightly softened. Add the diced butternut squash, dried thyme, ground cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Stir to combine and cook for another 5 minutes. Pour in the white wine and let it simmer for a couple of minutes to allow the alcohol to cook off. Add the vegetable broth to the pot and bring to a boil. Reduce the heat to low, cover, and let it simmer for about 20-25 minutes, or until the butternut squash is tender. Remove the pot from heat and let the soup cool slightly. Using an immersion blender or regular blender, puree the soup until smooth and creamy. If using a regular blender, be careful when blending hot liquids and work in batches if necessary. Return the blended soup to the pot and reheat over low heat if needed. Adjust the seasoning with additional salt and pepper to taste. Ladle the butternut soup into bowls and garnish with fresh chopped parsley. Serve the Butternut Soup with White Wine as a comforting and flavorful starter for a vegan or vegetarian meal. The addition of white wine adds a subtle depth of flavor and complements the natural sweetness of the butternut squash.

Ingredients: pasta,  olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  mushrooms,  white wine,  vegetable broth,  almond or soy milk,  yeast,  cornstarch,  salt and pepper,  parsley
Instructions: Cook the pasta according to the package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the sliced onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion becomes translucent and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook until they release their moisture and start to brown, about 8 minutes. Pour in the white wine and let it simmer for a couple of minutes to allow the alcohol to cook off. In a separate bowl, whisk together the vegetable broth, plant-based milk, nutritional yeast, and cornstarch slurry until well combined. Pour the broth mixture into the skillet with the mushrooms. Stir well to combine and bring to a simmer. Cook for about 5 minutes, until the sauce thickens. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to coat the pasta evenly with the sauce. Remove from heat and serve the White Wine Mushroom Pasta hot, garnished with fresh chopped parsley.

Ingredients: pineapple,  rum,  maple syrup,  lime juice,  vanilla extract,  salt,  skewers
Instructions: Preheat your grill or grill pan over medium heat. Cut the pineapple into chunks or wedges, approximately 1-inch thick. In a small bowl, whisk together the rum, maple syrup, lime juice, vanilla extract, and salt. Thread the pineapple chunks onto the soaked wooden skewers. Brush the rum glaze onto all sides of the pineapple skewers, coating them evenly. Place the pineapple skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 2-3 minutes per side, or until grill marks appear and the pineapple starts to caramelize. Remove the skewers from the grill and brush them with any remaining glaze. Serve the Rum Glazed Pineapple Skewers warm as a delicious vegan and vegetarian-friendly dessert or snack option.

Ingredients: all-purpose flour,  baking soda,  salt,  granulated sugar,  Guinness stout,  unsweetened almond milk,  apple cider vinegar
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Lightly grease a baking sheet or line it with parchment paper. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the all-purpose flour, baking soda, salt, and granulated sugar. In a separate small bowl, mix together the Guinness stout, almond milk, and apple cider vinegar. Let it sit for a few minutes to curdle slightly. Pour the liquid mixture into the dry ingredients. Stir with a wooden spoon or your hands until the dough comes together. It will be slightly sticky. Transfer the dough onto a floured surface. Knead it gently for a minute until it forms a smooth ball. Shape the dough into a round loaf and place it onto the prepared baking sheet. Use a sharp knife to make a deep cross on top of the loaf. Bake in the preheated oven for about 30-35 minutes or until the bread is golden brown and sounds hollow when tapped on the bottom. Remove the Guinness Soda Bread from the oven and let it cool on a wire rack before slicing.

Ingredients: brussels sprouts,  olive oil,  garlic,  vegetable broth,  whiskey,  maple syrup,  soy sauce,  salt and pepper
Instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the Brussels sprouts and sauté for 5-7 minutes until they start to brown. Add the minced garlic and cook for an additional 1 minute until fragrant. In a small bowl, whisk together the vegetable broth, whiskey, maple syrup, and soy sauce. Pour the mixture into the skillet with the Brussels sprouts. Increase the heat to medium-high and let the sauce come to a simmer. Cook for 8-10 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the Brussels sprouts are tender and the sauce has thickened and reduced. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust the sweetness or spiciness by adding more maple syrup or a pinch of red pepper flakes, if desired. Remove from heat and serve the Whiskey Glazed Brussels Sprouts as a delicious side dish. They pair well with roasted meats, tofu, or as a topping for grain bowls.

Ingredients: all-purpose flour,  yeast,  salt,  olive oil,  marinara sauce,  tomatoes,   mozzarella cheese,  basil leaves,  red wine,  dried oregano,  garlic powder,  red pepper flakes
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 450°F (230°C). In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, instant yeast, and salt. Add the olive oil and warm water. Mix well until the dough comes together. Transfer the dough onto a lightly floured surface and knead for about 5 minutes until it becomes smooth and elastic. If the dough is too sticky, add a little more flour. Shape the dough into a ball and place it in a greased bowl. Cover with a clean kitchen towel and let it rise for 30 minutes or until it doubles in size. Meanwhile, prepare the red wine drizzle. In a small bowl, whisk together the red wine, olive oil, dried oregano, garlic powder, and red pepper flakes (if using). Set aside. Once the dough has risen, punch it down and divide it into two equal portions. Roll out each portion into a thin round pizza crust. Place the pizza crusts on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Spread a generous amount of marinara sauce on each crust, leaving a border around the edges. Arrange the tomato slices on top of the sauce. Sprinkle the vegan mozzarella cheese evenly over the tomatoes. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Bake the pizzas in the preheated oven for about 12-15 minutes, or until the crust is golden brown and the cheese is melted and bubbly. Remove the pizzas from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. Garnish with fresh basil leaves. Drizzle the prepared red wine mixture over the pizzas. Slice and serve the Vegan Margherita Pizza with Red Wine while still warm. Enjoy the delicious combination of tangy marinara, melty vegan cheese, and the subtle red wine flavor.

Ingredients: olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  tomatoes,  vodka,  cashew cream or coconut cream,  salt and pepper,  basil leaves,  pasta
Instructions: Cook the pasta according to the package instructions in a large pot of salted boiling water. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic. Sauté until the onion is translucent and the garlic is fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add the crushed tomatoes to the skillet and stir well. Bring the mixture to a simmer and let it cook for about 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. Remove the skillet from the heat and carefully add the vodka. Return the skillet to medium heat and cook for another 5 minutes to allow the alcohol to evaporate. Reduce the heat to low and stir in the plant-based cream. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Let the sauce simmer for an additional 5 minutes. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet with the vodka sauce. Toss well to coat the pasta evenly. Serve the Pasta with Vodka Sauce hot, garnished with fresh chopped basil leaves.

Ingredients: basmati rice,  vegetable broth,  saffron threads,  olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  white wine,  salt and pepper,  fresh parsley
linguine or spaghetti,  olive oil,  garlic,  white wine,  vegetable broth,  red pepper flakes,  salt and pepper,  fresh parsley
Instructions: Cook the pasta according to package instructions until al dente. Drain and set aside. In a large skillet, heat the olive oil over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant, being careful not to burn it. Pour in the white wine and cook for 2-3 minutes, allowing the alcohol to evaporate and the flavors to meld. Add the vegetable broth, red pepper flakes, salt, and pepper to the skillet. Stir well and let the mixture simmer for 5 minutes. Add the cooked pasta to the skillet and toss to coat it evenly with the white wine and garlic sauce. Cook for an additional 2-3 minutes, allowing the pasta to absorb the flavors. Remove the skillet from the heat. Taste and adjust the seasoning if needed. Serve the White Wine Garlic Pasta in individual plates or bowls. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Ingredients: olive oil,  onion,  garlic,  pumpkin,  vegetable broth,  white wine,  cumin,  cinnamon,  salt and pepper,  parsley
Instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large pot over medium heat. Add the chopped onion and minced garlic, and sauté until the onion is translucent and fragrant, about 5 minutes. Add the cubed pumpkin to the pot and cook for another 5 minutes, stirring occasionally. Pour in the vegetable broth and white wine. Bring the mixture to a boil, then reduce the heat and let it simmer for 20-25 minutes until the pumpkin is tender. Using an immersion blender or a regular blender, puree the soup until smooth and creamy. If using a regular blender, be careful when blending hot liquids. You may need to blend in batches. Return the soup to the pot and add the ground cumin and cinnamon. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Stir well to combine and let it simmer for an additional 5 minutes to allow the flavors to meld. Ladle the Pumpkin Soup into individual bowls. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Ingredients: mushrooms,  olive oil,  garlic,  red wine,  tamari or soy sauce,  balsamic vinegar,  dried thyme,  salt and pepper,  parsley
Instructions: Heat the olive oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add the minced garlic and sauté for 1-2 minutes until fragrant. Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until they start to soften and release their moisture. Pour in the red wine, tamari or soy sauce, balsamic vinegar, and dried thyme. Stir well to combine. Reduce the heat to low and let the mushrooms simmer in the wine mixture for another 10 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together and the liquid to reduce slightly. Season with salt and pepper to taste. Adjust the seasoning if needed. Remove the skillet from heat and transfer the Wine-Braised Mushrooms to a serving dish. Garnish with fresh parsley.

Ingredients: brussels sprouts,  olive oil,  red wine,  garlic,  dried thyme,  salt and pepper
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C). In a mixing bowl, combine the halved Brussels sprouts, olive oil, red wine, minced garlic, dried thyme, salt, and pepper. Toss well to evenly coat the Brussels sprouts with the marinade. Spread the Brussels sprouts in a single layer on a baking sheet lined with parchment paper. Roast in the preheated oven for about 25 minutes, or until the Brussels sprouts are tender and slightly caramelized, stirring once halfway through. Remove the Red Wine Roasted Brussels Sprouts from the oven and let them cool slightly before serving.

Ingredients: mixed vegetables (such as bell peppers,  zucchini,  cherry tomatoes,  red onion,  mushrooms),  red wine,  soy sauce or tamari,  balsamic vinegar,  garlic,  maple syrup or agave nectar,  dried oregano,  salt and pepper
Instructions: In a bowl, combine the red wine, low-sodium soy sauce or tamari, balsamic vinegar, minced garlic, maple syrup or agave nectar, dried oregano, salt, and pepper. Whisk well to create the marinade. Place the mixed vegetables in a large resealable bag or a shallow dish. Pour the marinade over the vegetables, making sure they are well coated. Seal the bag or cover the dish, and refrigerate for at least 1 hour (or up to 4 hours) to allow the flavors to meld. Preheat your grill or grill pan to medium-high heat. Thread the marinated vegetables onto skewers, alternating the different vegetables for variety. Place the vegetable skewers on the preheated grill and cook for about 10-12 minutes, turning occasionally, until the vegetables are tender and lightly charred. Remove the skewers from the grill and let them cool slightly before serving.

Ingredients: raw almonds,  red wine,  olive oil,  maple syrup or agave nectar,  smoked paprika,  sea salt,  black pepper,  cayenne pepper
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a mixing bowl, combine the red wine, olive oil, maple syrup or agave nectar, smoked paprika, sea salt, black pepper, and optional cayenne pepper. Whisk until well combined. Add the raw almonds to the bowl and toss them in the red wine mixture until evenly coated. Spread the coated almonds in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and roast the almonds for 15-20 minutes, stirring them halfway through, until they are fragrant and golden brown. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the almonds cool completely before serving.

Ingredients: mushrooms,  whiskey,  soy sauce or tamari,  maple syrup or agave nectar,  balsamic vinegar,  garlic,  smoked paprika,  black pepper,  parsley or cilantro
Instructions: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add the sliced mushrooms. Cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms release their moisture and start to brown. In a small bowl, whisk together the whiskey, soy sauce or tamari, maple syrup or agave nectar, balsamic vinegar, minced garlic, smoked paprika, and black pepper. Pour the whiskey glaze over the mushrooms in the skillet. Stir well to coat the mushrooms evenly. Reduce the heat to low and let the mushrooms simmer in the glaze for about 10 minutes, or until the glaze thickens slightly and coats the mushrooms. Remove the skillet from the heat and let the mushrooms cool for a few minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh parsley or cilantro, if desired.

Ingredients: mushrooms,  dry white wine,  vegetable broth,  garlic,  olive oil,  lemon juice,  dried thyme,  salt,  black pepper,  parsley
Instructions: Heat a non-stick skillet over medium heat and add the olive oil. Once hot, add the minced garlic and sauté for about 1 minute until fragrant. Add the sliced mushrooms to the skillet and cook for about 5 minutes, stirring occasionally, until the mushrooms start to release their moisture. Pour in the white wine and vegetable broth, and stir well to combine. Cook for another 5 minutes, allowing the mushrooms to absorb the flavors. Add the lemon juice, dried thyme, salt, and black pepper to the skillet. Stir to coat the mushrooms evenly. Reduce the heat to low and let the mushrooms simmer for an additional 5 minutes, allowing the flavors to meld together. Remove the skillet from the heat and let the mushrooms cool for a few minutes before serving. Garnish with fresh parsley, if desired.

Ingredients: zucchini,  all-purpose flour,  baking powder,  paprika,  garlic powder,  salt,  black pepper,  light beer
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly coat it with cooking spray. Cut the zucchini into fry-like shapes, about 1/4-inch thick and 3-4 inches long. Set aside. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Slowly pour in the light beer while whisking, until a smooth batter forms. The batter should be thick but pourable. Dip each zucchini fry into the batter, allowing any excess batter to drip off, and place it on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat until all the fries are coated. Lightly spray the fries with cooking spray to help them crisp up in the oven. Bake for about 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, or until the fries are golden brown and crispy. Remove from the oven and let the fries cool for a few minutes before serving. Serve the beer-battered zucchini fries with your favorite dipping sauce, such as vegan ranch, marinara, or a spicy vegan mayo.

Ingredients: onions,  all-purpose flour,  baking powder,  paprika,  garlic powder,  salt,  black pepper,  light beer
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C). Line a baking sheet with parchment paper and lightly coat it with cooking spray. Peel the onions and slice them into thick rings, about 1/2-inch wide. Separate the rings and set them aside. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, paprika, garlic powder, salt, and black pepper. Slowly pour in the light beer while whisking, until a smooth batter forms. The batter should be thick but pourable. Dip each onion ring into the batter, allowing any excess batter to drip off, and place it on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat until all the onion rings are coated. Lightly spray the onion rings with cooking spray to help them crisp up in the oven. Bake for about 20-25 minutes, flipping halfway through, or until the onion rings are golden brown and crispy. Remove from the oven and let the onion rings cool for a few minutes before serving. Serve the beer-battered onion rings with your favorite dipping sauce, such as vegan ranch, barbecue sauce, or spicy ketchup.

Ingredients: grain baguette,  tomatoes,  red onion,  fresh basil,  extra-virgin olive oil,  white wine vinegar,  garlic,  salt and pepper
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 375°F (190°C). Place the bread slices on a baking sheet and toast them in the oven until golden and crispy, about 8-10 minutes. Remove from the oven and set aside. In a mixing bowl, combine the diced tomatoes, red onion, basil, olive oil, white wine vinegar, minced garlic, salt, and pepper. Toss well to combine. Let the tomato mixture marinate for about 10-15 minutes to allow the flavors to blend together. Once the bread slices have cooled slightly, spoon the tomato mixture evenly onto each slice. Serve the bruschetta immediately as an appetizer or light snack.

Ingredients: all-purpose flour,  baking powder,  baking soda,  salt,  unsweetened applesauce,  granulated sugar,  vegetable oil,  almond milk,  vanilla extract,  strawberries,  powdered sugar,  vegan butter,  champagne
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a muffin tin with cupcake liners. In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, baking soda, and salt. In a separate large bowl, combine the applesauce, granulated sugar, vegetable oil, almond milk, and vanilla extract. Mix well until smooth. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients, mixing until just combined. Be careful not to overmix. Gently fold in the diced strawberries. Spoon the batter into the cupcake liners, filling each about two-thirds full. Bake for 15-18 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center of a cupcake comes out clean. Remove the cupcakes from the oven and let them cool completely on a wire rack. While the cupcakes are cooling, prepare the frosting. In a mixing bowl, beat together the powdered sugar, softened vegan butter, champagne, and vanilla extract until smooth and creamy. Once the cupcakes are completely cooled, frost them with the champagne frosting using a piping bag or a spatula. Garnish each cupcake with a fresh strawberry.

Ingredients: raw nuts (such as almonds,  pecans,  or walnuts),  pure maple syrup,  whiskey,  vanilla extract,  cinnamon,  salt
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a small bowl, whisk together the maple syrup, whiskey, vanilla extract, cinnamon, and salt until well combined. Place the raw nuts in a separate large bowl and pour the maple syrup mixture over them. Stir until all the nuts are evenly coated. Spread the coated nuts in a single layer on the prepared baking sheet. Bake in the preheated oven for 12-15 minutes, stirring once halfway through, until the nuts are golden brown and fragrant. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the nuts cool completely on the pan. They will continue to crisp up as they cool. Once the nuts are completely cool, transfer them to an airtight container for storage.

Ingredients: red grapes,   red wine,  maple syrup,  vanilla extract,  salt
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 400°F (200°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a bowl, combine the red wine, maple syrup, vanilla extract, and salt. Stir until well combined. Place the red grapes in a separate bowl and pour the red wine mixture over them. Toss gently to coat the grapes evenly. Transfer the coated grapes to the prepared baking sheet, spreading them out in a single layer. Roast the grapes in the preheated oven for about 20-25 minutes, or until they become soft and slightly wrinkled. Remove the baking sheet from the oven and let the roasted grapes cool for a few minutes before serving.

Ingredients: potatoes,  all-purpose flour,  baking powder,  salt,  paprika,  garlic powder,  onion powder,  beer,  oil,  salt and pepper
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. Cut the potatoes into thin fries, about 1/4 inch thick. Place them in a large bowl and cover with cold water. Let them soak for about 30 minutes to remove excess starch. Drain and pat dry with a clean kitchen towel or paper towels. In a separate bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder. Slowly pour in the cold vegan beer while whisking until the batter is smooth and well combined. The batter should be thick but still pourable. Heat a large skillet or frying pan over medium-high heat and add enough cooking spray or oil to cover the bottom of the pan. Dip each potato fry into the batter, making sure it's fully coated, and then carefully place it in the hot pan. Repeat until the pan is full but not overcrowded. Cook the fries for about 2-3 minutes on each side, or until they turn golden brown and crispy. Remove them from the pan and transfer to the prepared baking sheet. Repeat the process with the remaining potato fries, adding more cooking spray or oil as needed. Once all the fries are cooked, place the baking sheet in the preheated oven and bake for an additional 10-15 minutes to ensure they are fully cooked and crispy. Season the fries with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

Ingredients: cauliflower,  all-purpose flour,  baking powder,  salt,  paprika,  garlic powder,  onion powder,  beer,  oil
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 425°F (220°C) and line a baking sheet with parchment paper. In a large mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, baking powder, salt, paprika, garlic powder, and onion powder. Slowly pour in the cold vegan beer while whisking until the batter is smooth and well combined. The batter should be thick but still pourable. Dip each cauliflower floret into the batter, making sure it's fully coated, and then place it on the prepared baking sheet. Repeat until all the florets are coated. Lightly spray or brush the coated cauliflower florets with cooking spray or oil. Bake in the preheated oven for 15-20 minutes, or until the cauliflower is tender and the batter is crispy and golden brown. While the cauliflower is baking, prepare your dipping sauce or condiments of choice. Once the cauliflower bites are cooked, remove them from the oven and let them cool for a few minutes. Season the cauliflower bites with salt and pepper to taste before serving.

Ingredients: all-purpose flour,  sugar,  salt,  almond milk or oat milk,  water,  vegetable oil,  orange juice,  vegan butter,  brown sugar,  orange liqueur
Instructions: In a mixing bowl, whisk together the flour, sugar, and salt. Gradually pour in the plant-based milk, water, and vegetable oil. Whisk until you have a smooth batter. Heat a non-stick skillet or crepe pan over medium heat. Lightly grease the pan with cooking spray or a small amount of oil. Pour about 1/4 cup of the batter into the center of the pan. Quickly tilt and rotate the pan to spread the batter in a thin, even layer. Cook the crepe for about 1-2 minutes, or until the edges start to lift and the bottom is lightly golden. Use a spatula to gently flip the crepe and cook for an additional 1-2 minutes on the other side. Repeat the process with the remaining batter. In a separate skillet, combine the orange juice, vegan butter, and brown sugar. Cook over medium heat until the butter has melted and the mixture is slightly reduced and syrupy. Remove the skillet from heat and stir in the orange liqueur. Be cautious as the alcohol may ignite briefly when added to the hot mixture. Carefully dip each crepe into the sauce, folding it into quarters. Place the folded crepes back into the skillet and cook for another minute, allowing them to soak up the flavors of the sauce. Serve the crepes warm with any remaining sauce drizzled over the top. You can also garnish with fresh orange segments or vegan whipped cream, if desired.

Ingredients: all-purpose flour,  unsweetened cocoa powder,  baking powder,  salt,  coconut oil,  granulated sugar,  Kahlua,  unsweetened almond milk,  vanilla extract,  dark chocolate chips
Instructions: Preheat your oven to 350°F (175°C) and line a square baking pan with parchment paper. In a medium bowl, whisk together the flour, cocoa powder, baking powder, and salt. In a separate large bowl, whisk together the melted coconut oil, granulated sugar, Kahlua, almond milk, and vanilla extract until well combined. Gradually add the dry ingredients to the wet ingredients and stir until just combined. Be careful not to overmix. Fold in the dairy-free dark chocolate chips into the brownie batter. Pour the batter into the prepared baking pan and spread it out evenly. Bake in the preheated oven for 25-30 minutes, or until a toothpick inserted into the center comes out with a few moist crumbs.
